Module documentation lacniclabs¶

Processing the RIRs ‘delegated-stats’ files¶

delegated.py: Implements delegated API on top of csv import (c) carlos@lacnic.net 20151201

author:Carlos Martinez, carlos@lacnic.net
date:20151201
class lacniclabs.netdata.delegated.delegatedStats(**kwargs)[source]¶

Imports delegated stats file from the RIRs.

Class attributes:
s3l / dbh : handle to sql3load instance.
_add_columns()[source]¶

Add meta columns and calculate their corresponding values.

_add_equiv_column()[source]¶
_download_stats_file(**kwargs)[source]¶

Downloads stats file for a given rir and date. Args ‘rir’ and ‘date’ (date can be ‘latest’) Load delegated-stats file and current RIR for given date (YYYYMMDD|latest)

Parameters:
  • rir= – RIR name
  • date= – Date as in YYYYMMDD or ‘latest’
_populate_columns(w_col_name, w_row)[source]¶

Calculates meta columns for the delegated file. :param w_col_name: column being calculated :param w_row: dictionary with current row values

q(w_query)[source]¶

Shorthand for sql3load rawquery, so you can write shorter statements.

qs(w_query)[source]¶

Queries db expecting a single value, returns a single value.

Importing RIPE NCC’s RISWHOIS Dumps¶

rishois.py : Imports RIS WHOIS Dumps for both IPv4 and IPv6 into an SQL Lite database

author:carlos@lacnic.net
date:20151221
class lacniclabs.netdata.riswhois.risWhois(**kwargs)[source]¶

This class imports RIPE-NCC’s daily RIS Whois text dumps, enrichs them with additional metadata and provides an SQL interface to them.

Author:Carlos M. Martinez, carlos@lacnic.net
_add_columns()[source]¶

Add meta columns to the riswhois database.

_download_dump_files()[source]¶

Downloads RIPE NCCs dump files, both for ipv4 and ipv6

_populate_columns(w_col_name, w_row)[source]¶

Calculates meta columns for the delegated file. :param w_col_name: column being calculated :param w_row: dictionary with current row values

addEntries(**kwargs)[source]¶

Add additional entries to the current file

q(w_query)[source]¶

Shorthand for sql3load rawquery, so you can write shorter statements.

qs(w_query)[source]¶

Queries db expecting a single value, returns a single value.
